effect thereof be it ordained by the mayor and board of aldermen of the city of west monroe louisiana in legal session convened that pursuant to of the louisiana constitution of 1974 and of the charter of the city of west monroe a codification of the ordinances of the city of west monroe louisiana is hereby adopted as the the city of west monroe louisiana which codification shall supersede the prior 1976 codification and all amendments thereto be it further ordained by the mayor and board of aldermen of the city of west monroe louisiana in legal session convened that this adoption and enactment of this not affect any offense or act committed or done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established or accruing before the effective date of this adoption and enactment  nor shall such adoption and enactment affect any ordinance heretofore validly in force and effect the provisions of the the city of west monroe louisiana being considered as continuations of the previously enacted the city of west monroe louisiana and ordinances of the city of west monroe louisiana and not as new enactments thereof the above ordinance was read in full considered by sections and upon a vote being taken the following result was had yea 5 nay 0 absent 0 not voting 0 whereupon the mayor of the city of west monroe louisiana declared said ordinance to be duly adopted included 20 4656 31219 included 50 charter preamble we the body politic of the corporation of west monroe louisiana beseeching the supreme power of god for wisdom and judgment do herewith establish and maintain a form and document of government for the maintenance and enhancement of our essential human rights dignity and freedom regarding form and substance as only manifestations of the essential democratic consideration of mans relations with his fellow man may we willingly sacrifice our individual desires to the greater good of our community to this end and for these purposes our individual and corporate efforts are dedicated footnotes  1  editors note the home rule charter was ratified on  a copy is recorded in the records of ouachita parish louisiana section catchlines and numbers from the 1976 the city are maintained in the charter except that the prefix number of section numbers has been dropped  eg  3302 becomes  302 state constitution reference home rule charter la const art vi  4 state law reference adoption of home rule charter rs  et seq article i  incorporation  form of government  boundaries  powers incorporation the inhabitants of the city of west monroe louisiana within the corporate limits as now established or as hereafter established by law shall be and continue a body politic and corporate to perpetuity under the name of the city of west monroe louisiana hereinafter referred to as the city form of government the municipal government provided by this charter shall be known as the mayorboard of aldermen form of government it shall consist of an elected board of aldermen that shall constitute the legislative branch of the government and an elected mayor who shall be the chief executive officer and head of the executive branch boundaries the boundaries of the city of west monroe louisiana shall be those as presently set forth in changes in the boundaries of the city shall be made by ordinance in accordance with applicable state general law state law reference extension of corporate limits of municipality by means of petition and election rs  et seq powers the city shall have all powers possible for a city to have under the constitution and laws of this state as fully and completely as though they were specifically enumerated in this charter except as expressly modified or changed by this charter the powers of the city under this charter shall be construed liberally in favor of the city and the specific mention of particular powers in the charter shall not be construed as limiting in any way the general powers stated in this charter the city may exercise any of its powers or perform any of its functions and may participate in the financing thereof jointly or in cooperation by contract or otherwise with any one or more states or civil divisions or agencies thereof or the united states or any agency thereof state law reference intergovernmental functions rs  et seq article ii  board of aldermen governing authority and legislative power the board of aldermen shall be the governing authority of the city for purposes of legislation and policymaking election  size the board of aldermen of the city shall consist of five 5 members elected at large for fouryear terms concurrent with that of the mayor qualifications members of the board of aldermen shall be qualified electors of the city and shall hold no other public office for which they shall be entitled to receive any remuneration or per diem compensation except that of notary public or membership in the national guard or reserve defense establishment members of the board of aldermen must be twentyone 21 years of age and shall have been a resident of the city for one 1 year and a resident of ouachita parish for at least two 2 years members of the board of aldermen shall not have been convicted of a felony any member of the board of aldermen ceasing to possess these qualifications or who is convicted of a felony shall immediately become disqualified creating a vacancy in the office state law reference felony defined rs  salary the annual salary of members of the board of aldermen shall be one thousand two hundred dollars $120000 until changed by ordinance any ordinance increasing the salary or granting any other monetary compensation to members of the board of aldermen shall be effective only after the next regular mayoralty election and must have been passed at least six 6 months prior to said election vacancies vacancies in the office of alderman shall be filled by mayoralty appointment with the concurrence of the board of aldermen if the term of office to be filled is less than one 1 year if the term is greater than one 1 year a special election to be held within ninety 90 days of the creation of the vacancy shall be called by the mayor officers at the first regular meeting of a newly elected board of aldermen a mayor pro tempore shall be elected from among the membership of the aldermen the mayor pro tempore shall perform all duties delegated to the mayor in this charter in the absence of the mayor and shall serve for a term of four 4 years in the event of temporary absence andor disability of both the mayor and mayor pro tempore then the remaining board of aldermen shall elect a temporary mayor from their membership who shall perform the duties of the mayor meetings a the mayor and board of aldermen shall hold not less than one 1 regular meeting in each month on a date and at a place and hour to be fixed by ordinance each newly elected council shall at its first regular meeting set by ordinance a date place and hour for its regular monthly meeting and shall retain this date throughout its term of four 4 years b special meetings of the mayor and board of aldermen may be called for the transaction of important business at the instance of the mayor or any alderman c the notice for a special meeting must specify in detail the objects and purposes for which the meeting is called  must be signed by the officer calling the meeting and must be served by any police officer of the municipality on the mayor and a majority of the members of the board the notice may be served either personally or at the domicile of the officer to be notified and shall be served in either event at least twelve 12 hours prior to the hour fixed in the call for the special meeting the police officer making such service shall make a diligent effort to make either personal or domiciliary service on the mayor and each member of the board of aldermen the police officer serving the notice shall make his return on the back of a copy of the call reciting the time and manner of service thus made by him upon the mayor and each member of the board this return together with the call for the special meeting shall be transcribed upon the minutes of the special meeting by the clerk the mayor or any member of the board may waive notice of this meeting in writing d no business except such as is specified in the call for the special meeting shall be transacted at the meeting except by unanimous consent of the board e in all cases it shall require a majority of the aldermen elected to constitute a quorum f meetings whether regular or special may be continued over to another specified date upon the unanimous consent of the aldermen if any meeting regular or special fails for want of a quorum any number of the aldermen less than a quorum may adjourn the meeting to another specified date but in no case shall adjourned meetings be prolonged beyond the end of the month in which they are scheduled to take place or be continued or adjourned more than once or to any date except that specified at the continuance or adjournment g all meetings of the mayor and board of aldermen shall be public  however the mayor and board of aldermen may recess for the purpose of discussing in a closed or executive session limited to its own membership and such other persons as the governing body may deem necessary any matter which would tend to defame or prejudice the character or reputation of any person or any other matter which the mayor and board of aldermen in their discretion should best be preliminarily discussed in executive session h all official action of the mayor and board of aldermen shall be taken only in open public session at duly constituted meetings policies and employees a the mayor and board of aldermen shall adopt policies not inconsistent with this charter governing its own organization business and employees such policies shall be kept in written form and in the form of a policy manual this manual shall further include a listing of duties of the various department heads and the functions of their department as defined by this charter ordinance or administrative ruling a copy of this manual shall be made available to the mayor and each member of the board of aldermen the responsibility for keeping the policy manual current shall be that of the city clerk b the mayor subject to the approval of the board of aldermen shall at the first regular meeting of the mayor and board of aldermen appoint a city clerk who shall serve at his pleasure the clerk shall give notice of meetings keep records of proceedings record and authenticate actions of the mayor and board of aldermen and do and perform all other actions required by state law this charter and direction of the board c the board of aldermen shall provide for an independent annual audit of all city accounts and may provide for such more infrequent audits as it deems necessary such audits shall be made by a certified public accountant or firm of such accountants who have no personal interest direct or indirect in the fiscal affairs of the city government or any of its officers the contractee shall not be a public officer official or employee of the city nor shall he hold any political office or be an officer or employee of any political party or organization the audit shall be conducted in all respects in accordance with state law and the report shall be tendered to the mayor and board of aldermen city clerk and shall be published in the official journal d the board of aldermen shall have the right to employ special legal counsel by written contract should the need arise state law reference duties of clerk rs   annual audit rs  actions a except as provided in this section actions may be taken either by ordinance resolution or motion at the discretion of the mayor and board of aldermen b all actions having the force and effect of law  or any action that creates a contractual obligation of the city  or any action establishing a fine or other penalty  or any action that requires an expenditure of funds either immediately or in the future  or any action making an appropriation  authorizing the borrowing of money  levying a tax  license or other revenue measure  creating a district  establishing a rule regulation or law for the violation of which a fine or imprisonment can be imposed  granting or revoking a franchise or placing any burden upon or limiting the use of private property shall be by ordinance c notwithstanding the provisions of the preceding paragraph it is hereby provided that all actions that must be taken pursuant to a general statutory law for the issuance of bonds or other evidences of indebtedness or for the construction of sewerage street paving water and drainage improvements that are to be financed by local or special assessments are excepted from the provisions of this section requiring the adoption of an ordinance if a resolution is the form of action prescribed by the general statutory law pursuant to which the bonds or other evidences of indebtedness are being issued or the construction and financing of the aforesaid improvements are being undertaken it is hereby further provided that if an ordinance is the form of action required by general statutory law for the issuance of bonds or other evidences of indebtedness or for the construction of sewerage street paving water and drainage improvements to be financed by local or special assessments the requirements of section 214 hereof shall not apply insofar as it requires ordinances to be read in full prior to their adoption editors note of the charter referred to above is codified herein as section 211 emergency action a the mayor and board of aldermen may waive the procedural requirements of this charter for the passage of ordinances which are necessary for the preservation of the public peace health and safety an emergency ordinance shall be adopted by the affirmative vote of fourfifths of the entire authorized membership of the board of aldermen and the nature of the emergency shall be specifically stated in the minutes of the meeting of the governing body emergency legislation may be vetoed by the mayor immediately after its passage but another fourfifths vote of the board of aldermen immediately after the mayors veto shall override the mayors veto emergency legislation shall be effective upon passage b emergency ordinances shall be effective for no longer than thirty 30 days the board of aldermen however upon a vote of fourfifths of its membership may extend the life of an emergency ordinance for an additional thirty 30 days but no such ordinance may be extended beyond that period ordinances the style of all ordinances shall be be it ordained by the mayor and board of aldermen of the city of west monroe louisiana  all ordinances shall within fourteen 14 days after they are passed be published once in the official journal of the municipality or if there be none in some newspaper of general circulation therein ordinances shall not be enforced unless for a cause the contrary be ordered until the day after their publication all ordinances and resolutions shall be read and considered by sections at a public meeting of the mayor and board of aldermen and if adopted shall be signed by the mayor or other officer presiding in his absence the vote on their final passage shall be taken by yeas and nays which shall be entered on the minutes by the clerk a vote shall never be taken on an ordinance not previously reduced to typewritten form an ordinance shall contain only one 1 subject which shall be indicated in its title an ordinance which is amended or revised shall set forth in full the section as amended or revised the clerk shall keep a book to be styled ordinances city of west monroe louisiana in which he shall file the original of every ordinance which has been adopted immediately after its passage  he shall append to each a note stating the date of its passage and cite therein the book and page of the minutes containing the record of its passage the ordinances to be so recorded are those which are in their nature laws of the municipality and not mere orders or decrees temporary in their nature veto of ordinances by mayor any ordinance vetoed by the mayor in accordance with the provisions of this charter shall not be overridden until the next regular meeting of the mayor and board of aldermen at the next regular session a simple majority vote shall be sufficient to override the mayors veto this section shall not apply to emergency ordinances which must be immediately vetoed by the mayor and which veto by the mayor can be then subsequently at the same meeting overridden by another fourfifths vote of the board of aldermen all as provided hereinabove in this charter investigation and removal the board of aldermen may investigate the operation of any department or agency of the city government or any department or agency which derives support from appropriations made by the board of aldermen in any such investigation the board of aldermen may administer oaths subpoena witnesses and compel the production of records herein shall be construed to prevent the codification of all ordinances of the city of west monroe louisiana the authority being granted that the mayor and board of aldermen shall provide for the codification of the ordinances and laws of the city of west monroe louisiana at such time when sufficient funds are available at such time when the codification of ordinances becomes a reality as provided for herein the classification and arrangement of all ordinances of general applicability shall be in accordance with the the city of west monroe louisiana the city attorney shall keep the the mayor and board of aldermen shall in its discretion decide upon periodic published revisions of the iii  mayor executive authority the mayor shall be the executive officer of the city all executive and administrative authority shall be exercised by and mayor except as set forth in this charter the mayor will be responsible for conducting and administering all business and affairs of the city employing and terminating the employment of all personnel except those positions specifically named herein that require the approval of the board of aldermen expending all funds as provided for in the budget collecting all revenues due the city and all other duties not specifically delegated to the board of aldermen or other officer by this charter the mayor shall be permitted to cast a vote at meetings of the mayor and board of aldermen in case of a tie election and term the next general election for the mayor and board of aldermen of the city shall be held on the tuesday next following the second monday of june 1974 and every four 4 years thereafter the officials elected shall qualify and enter the discharge of their duties on the first day of july after their election the terms of office for the mayor and members of the board of aldermen shall be concurrent and shall be for four 4 years the provisions of state law with regard to municipal primary elections etc shall govern insofar as they are not inconsistent with the provisions of this charter state law reference elections rs  et seq qualifications the mayor shall be a qualified elector of the city and shall hold no other public office for which he shall be entitled to receive any remuneration or per diem compensation except that of notary public or membership in the national guard or reserve defense establishment the mayor must be twentyone 21 years of age and shall have been a resident of the city for one 1 year and a resident of ouachita parish for at least two 2 years the mayor shall not have been convicted of a felony any mayor ceasing to possess these qualifications or who is convicted of a felony shall immediately become disqualified creating a vacancy in the office salary the annual salary of the mayor shall be nine thousand dollars $900000 and in addition the mayor shall be entitled to be furnished a suitable vehicle and a monthly expense account of one hundred dollars $10000 the mayors salary and other compensation remuneration or expenses set forth in this section shall be changed only by ordinance any ordinance increasing the salary or granting another monetary compensation for the mayor shall be effective only after the next regular mayoralty election and must have been passed at least six 6 months prior to said election vacancy a during a temporary absence from the city or temporary inability to perform the duties of the office of the mayor the vacancy shall be filled by the mayor pro tempore the mayor pro tempore shall not participate in the capacity of an aldermen in regular meetings of the mayorboard of aldermen during his period as acting mayor b in the event of a vacancy in the office of mayor when the term will expire in less than one 1 year the mayor pro tempore shall succeed to the mayoralty a vacancy shall then have been created on the board of aldermen to be filled in accordance with the terms of this charter if the term of office of the mayor shall be for a period greater than one 1 year a special election to be held within ninety 90 days shall be called by the board of aldermen office the mayor shall maintain his office in the city hall of the city of west monroe louisiana authority and responsibility the mayor in his executive capacity shall supervise and direct the operations of all departments of government he shall appoint and remove all personnel and employees of the city except those positions that specifically require the approval of the board of aldermen he shall be ex officio a nonvoting member of all boards and commissions and shall coordinate their efforts with other agencies of the city government he shall appoint and remove all city officials subject to the provisions of state law and this charter he shall appoint all members of boards and commissions except those which specifically require the approval of the board of aldermen he shall be charged with the enforcement of applicable state law this charter ordinances of the city and with the general enforcement of the law he shall prepare and submit to the board of aldermen the pay plan the operating and capital budgets and the capital plan he shall execute all contracts agreements instruments of debt and the like for which the city is obligated except such instruments as the director of finance may be authorized to execute as herein provided he shall be the custodian of the seal of the city veto a all ordinances passed by the board of aldermen shall be dated and delivered no later than the day following the meeting in which said ordinances were passed to the office of the mayor by the city clerk the mayor shall have five 5 calendar days from the date of the meeting in which said ordinance or ordinances were passed either to sign the ordinance or veto it after action by the mayor within the required time he shall immediately return the ordinance to the city clerk together with his written reasons in the event of veto this section shall not apply to emergency ordinances which are specifically covered elsewhere in this charter b an ordinance vetoed by the mayor shall be vetoed in full the veto of the mayor cannot be overridden by the board of aldermen until the next regular meeting of the mayorboard of aldermen following the veto at the next regular meeting a simple majority vote by the board of aldermen shall be sufficient to override the mayors veto this section shall not apply to the veto of emergency ordinances which is provided for elsewhere in this charter relation to board of aldermen the mayor may present to the board of aldermen messages and requests for action the mayor shall preside at all public meetings of the mayor and board of aldermen unless for cause he is unable to do so and be heard on matters currently before that body the mayor shall have no power of vote except in case of a tie and the mayor shall be unable to introduce ordinances or resolutions that have the effect of law report at the close of each fiscal year the mayor shall render to the board of aldermen and the public a financial and administrative report on activities of the preceding year article iv  administration organization and control a the administrative branch of the government shall be under the direction control and supervision of the mayor the mayor shall carry out the policy direction of the board of aldermen and shall be responsible for the overall enforcement of the law b the mayor or his designee may investigate the administration and actions of any agency of the city government under his direction the mayor may prescribe administrative standards and regulations not inconsistent with policy established by the board of aldermen which shall be applicable for all agencies of the administrative branch such administrative rules and regulations shall be reduced to writing and attached to the policy manual referred to elsewhere in this charter administrative officer there is hereby created the position of chief administrative officer of the city of west monroe louisiana this position shall be under the direct supervision of the mayor the chief administrative officer shall be appointed by the mayor and shall assume such duties as the mayor may assign to him he shall be granted such powers and duties in the area of administration that the mayor shall see fit to grant to him that are not inconsistent with the laws of this state and this charter the administrative officer shall serve at the mayors pleasure departments and department heads a at such time as this charter shall go into effect there shall be in existence the following departments 1 legal department  2 department of community services and recreation  3 fire department  4 police department  5 city clerk  6 utilities and maintenance department the head of the legal department shall be the city attorney  the head of the department of community services and recreation shall be the director of community services and recreation  the head of the fire department shall be the fire chief the head of the police department shall be the police chief  the city clerk shall head the city clerks office  and the head of the utilities and maintenance department shall be the supervisor of utilities and maintenance b the mayor is charged with the responsibility of employing and terminating all personnel of the city and department heads except those department heads or employees which specifically require the approval of the board of aldermen under the provisions of this charter and applicable state law legal department a the head of the legal department shall be the city attorney he shall be appointed by the mayor and shall be responsible to the mayor and board of aldermen only and shall not be directly responsible to department heads and other city employees the city attorney shall be a licensed attorney with at least a minimum of five 5 years experience in the practice of law the city attorney shall not hold any other public office either appointive or elective except that of notary public the city attorney shall be required to represent and advise the elected mayor and board of aldermen in all legal matters of the city the city attorney shall be the head of the legal department and his salary and that of any member of the legal department shall be fixed by the mayor and board of aldermen b the city attorney shall supervise the conduct of the legal affairs of the city  shall prepare ordinances upon request of the mayor or an alderman and shall render written opinions as to the legality of all contracts franchises and other legal instruments and generally perform all legal duties connected with the affairs of the city the city attorney or one of his assistants shall be the prosecutor in the west monroe city court c assistant city attorneys may be appointed by the mayor and their salaries fixed by the mayor and board of aldermen department of community services and recreation a the head of the department of community services and recreation shall be the director of community services and recreation the director shall be appointed by the mayor and serve at his pleasure the director shall have a broad and comprehensive background in this field b the director of community services and recreation shall direct and be responsible for programs of athletics recreational activities cultural and any other leisure time activities fire department a the head of the fire department shall be the fire chief who shall be appointed by the mayor and approved by the board of aldermen in accordance with applicable law b the fire chief shall direct and be responsible for firefighting apparatus fire stations and all equipment including fire hydrants fire extinguishment and salvage operations inspection and recommendations concerning the fire code of the city investigation of fires and their causes and the conduction of fire safety rescue and prevention programs state law reference fire department rs  et seq police department a the head of the police department shall be the police chief who shall be appointed by the mayor and approved by the board of aldermen in accordance with applicable law b the police chief shall direct and be responsible for the prevention of crime law enforcement assistance to the courts and other law enforcement agencies peace of the city and the maintenance and welfare of the police department and its facilities the police department shall not be responsible for administrative duties that would normally be the function of any other department or agency of the city as provided for in this charter or by state law c unless otherwise provided for by state or federal law no persons shall exercise police authority in the city of west monroe louisiana except regularly constituted law enforcement officers of the city parish state or federal government limited special police powers may be granted by permit by the police chief if authorized by ordinance state law reference police department rs  et seq  arrest by private person crim proc art 214 et seq office of city clerk the head of the city clerks office or department shall be the city clerk of the city of west monroe louisiana the city clerk shall keep a book to be labeled municipal minutes city of west monroe in which shall be recorded the proceedings of the mayor and board of aldermen and keep the same fully indexed alphabetically so that all entries on the minutes can be easily found the clerk shall be the custodian of the municipal seal the clerk shall keep a book to be styled municipal docket city of west monroe upon which he shall enter each claim against the municipality and each subject matter to be acted upon by the mayor and board of aldermen he shall examine the statutes of the state and the ordinances of the municipality to ascertain subject matter required or proper to be acted upon at the following meeting and shall docket or place on the agenda all such matters he shall keep such other books and records as may be provided for by ordinance and shall file in his office and preserve all records and papers appertaining to the business of the municipality the city clerk shall bill and collect all real estate and movable property taxes collect occupational licenses bill and collect water and sanitation fees bill and collect street paving assessments and maintain all accounting records relating thereto the clerk shall be responsible for all accounting including payrolls accounts receivable and accounts payable the clerk shall prepare a monthly financial statement for the mayor and board of aldermen he shall publish all legal notices in the official journal of the city the clerk shall keep a record of the bonded indebtedness make payments keep cancelled bonds and coupons in bond books all as prescribed by state statute the city clerk shall be the treasurer of the city of west monroe state law reference bonded indebtedness rs  et seq utilities and maintenance department a the head of the department of utilities and maintenance shall be the supervisor of the department of utilities and maintenance and this department shall be responsible for the functions which provide and maintain public works utilities and services the supervisor shall be appointed by the mayor and serve at the pleasure of the mayor b this department shall be responsible for all city properties and service functions supervise contract constructions supervise and maintain the water and sewerage systems storm sewers their collection and disposal the responsibilities of this department shall include streets and sidewalks their construction cleaning and maintenance drainage ditches canals bridges cemetery operation and maintenance garbage collection and disposal general sanitation control of weeds grass trees shrubbery maintenance of all city owned movable and immovable property and any related activities this department shall also in the area of utilities control be responsible for the water supply to the community its equipment facilities and supplies sewerage the collection and disposal of sewage installation and maintenance of street lights and all other supplies and equipment owned or operated by the city which facilitate the service of utilities and any other related activities new departments authorized a the mayor and board of aldermen of the city shall at such time as they deem necessary provide for the revision and reorganization of existing departmental units and may provide by ordinance for the creation of additional departmental units as follows 1 public works department the head of which shall be the director of public works  2 utilities department the head of which shall be the director of utilities  3 juvenile department the head of which shall be the juvenile officer  4 finance department the head of which shall be the finance director  5 any other departments and departmental heads as may be deemed necessary b in the event and at such time as the mayor and board of aldermen of this municipality shall deem it necessary to provide for the creation of a public works department utilities department juvenile department or finance department the following shall be a general guide as to the functions of said specifically named departments which general guide is intended to be inclusive and not exclusive 1 public works department a the head of the public works department shall be the director of public works this department shall be responsible for all aspects of the function of the public works of the city the director shall be appointed by the mayor and shall serve at the pleasure of the mayor at the time of appointment the director shall have at least five 5 years experience in a responsible managerial andor administrative field related to public works recommendations attesting to his ability and proficiency should be available b the department of public works under the supervision of the director shall direct and be responsible for the street drainage and engineering services for all city agencies this department will maintain all city properties of every nature and kind supervise contract construction conduct all surveys maps and the mapping and describing of city boundaries construction and maintenance of streets and sidewalks bridges and drainage systems connected therewith trash and garbage collection and disposals  street cleaning control of weeds and grass and any trees shrubbery or any objects deemed as hazards by the police department which might obstruct lineofsight clearance at street intersections or which might create hazards that may cause traffic accidents this department shall supervise and maintain storm water its collection and disposal facilities it shall be responsible for licensing and inspections in conjunction with zoning ordinances building and construction codes and licensing of trades this department shall be responsible for any related activities connected with any of the above responsibilities 2 utilities department the head of the utilities department shall be the director of utilities this department shall be responsible for the maintenance and operation of all city utilities including but not limited to water sewerage and sanitation systems and for the performance of such other duties as may be assigned to it by ordinance 3 juvenile department the head of the juvenile department shall be the juvenile officer the juvenile officer shall be specially trained or experienced in performing case work services in connection with juveniles the duties of the juvenile officer and this department shall be to investigate supervise and generally represent the interests of the juvenile offender in his relation to the west monroe city court and community prior to and while on probation status the juvenile officer shall be a duly appointed representative of the west monroe city court and shall work under the supervision of the west monroe city judge this person shall be appointed by the mayor and board of aldermen with the advice and consent of the city judge of the city of west monroe 4 finance department a the head of the finance department shall be the finance director the finance director shall be appointed by the mayor subject to the approval of the board of aldermen and after appointment shall serve at the pleasure of the mayor at the time of appointment the appointee should have a minimum of five 5 years experience in accounting or auditing managerial andor administrative experience in fiscal matters recommendations attesting to his ability and proficiency should be available b the director of finance shall collect all taxes licenses permit fees and fines and penalties awarded to the city by the courts and all other monies due to the city as provided by law the director of finance shall maintain the treasury of the city and negotiate agreements with depository banks subject to the approval of the board of aldermen as director of finance he shall procure and account for all property real and personal the materials and supplies and services required and authorized by the governing body he shall maintain perpetual inventory establish and supervise all accounts for all funds both operating and capital trust or otherwise the director of finance shall prepare and issue all checks for the city permitting no expenditures except those duly authorized in accordance with this charter city ordinance andor applicable state laws the finance director shall be the treasurer of the city of west monroe the director of finance shall be responsible for the execution and supervision of operating and capital budgets and provide assistance in budget preparations he shall provide information on fiscal matters requested by the mayor and shall perform any other duties as directed by the mayor andor any member of the board of aldermen in accordance with this charter or state laws applicable to municipal finance c other departments and departmental heads that may be created as authorized by this charter by the mayor and board of aldermen shall have their respective functions designated by ordinance at the time of their creation planning a a planning commission shall be established as authorized by lrs  et seq which shall consist of five 5 members appointed by the mayor with the approval of the board of aldermen and shall serve terms as specified by state law b a planning commission chairman shall be elected by the commission members from among its membership the term of chairmanship shall be set by the commission c the planning commission shall be responsible for preparation and administration of a master plan and zoning plan for the city  shall make recommendations on the capital program and capital budget  shall hear requests and decide disputes arising from zoning building and other codes  and shall exercise all other responsibilities affecting the physical development of the city any person not satisfied with a decision of the planning commission over disputes arising from zoning building and other codes may appeal the decision of such commission to the mayor and board of aldermen by filing a written notice of appeal with the office of the mayor within fifteen 15 days from the date of the decision of the commission the mayor and board of aldermen shall hear and decide these appeals at the earliest convenient date d a planning director may be appointed by the planning commission with the approval of the mayor and board of aldermen the duties and responsibilities of the planning director shall be established by the planning commission in keeping with its own duties and responsibilities the mayor and board of aldermen may budget funds for the operation of the planning directors office advisory boards and committees advisory boards and committees may be appointed and dissolved as needed by the mayor and board of aldermen and shall submit reports when requested by said body in the form requested by said body article v  personnel policy the policy of the city of west monroe shall be to employ from those available the persons best qualified to perform the functions of the city in the capacity for which these persons are employed merit except as otherwise provided for by state law appointments and promotions shall be made on the basis of merit and fitness as demonstrated by examination andor other evidence of competence director a personnel director shall be appointed by the mayor and serve at the pleasure of the mayor to administer the personnel system of the city the chief administrative officer may serve also in the capacity as personnel director rules and procedures the personnel director shall prepare from time to time personnel rules and procedures in writing for submission to the mayor and board of aldermen upon approval of the mayor and adoption by the board of aldermen either with or without amendment such rules and procedures shall be administered by the personnel director these rules and procedures shall be as comprehensive as possible and shall be kept in pamphlet or booklet form and shall be made available to all city employees and officers article vi  finance fiscal year the fiscal year of the city shall begin july first and end on june thirtieth until changed by ordinance which ordinance shall also make provision for appropriate change in the affected time schedules as set forth in this charter operating budget form the operating budget form shall be a detailed listing of proposed expenditures by all applicable departments agencies and offices of the city all as the mayor shall deem advisable the operating budget of revenues shall list in detail each item of revenue submission for study and adoption the mayor shall be responsible for the preparation of the operating budget prior to the submission of the budget to the board of aldermen the budget shall be reviewed by the finance committee of the board of aldermen for recommendations the budget shall be submitted to the board of aldermen no less than fortyfive 45 days prior to the beginning of the new fiscal year the budget as submitted or altered by the board of aldermen shall be adopted no later than fifteen 15 days prior to the beginning of the fiscal year if the board of aldermen fails to act upon and formally adopt a budget ten 10 days prior to the new fiscal year it shall be presumed to have adopted the budget as submitted by the mayor and the finance committee budget amendments and reporting passage of a budget ordinance shall constitute revenue levies and appropriations within the terms of the budget classifications there shall be no changes in the budget or fund transfers without amendment of the budget ordinance quarterly at the regular meeting of the mayor and board of aldermen a detailed current financial status report shall be presented to the members of the board of aldermen the mayor or his designee shall be responsible for presenting this quarterly report unexpended funds all appropriations shall be for one fiscal year at the end of the fiscal year the unexpended appropriated funds shall remain in the general fund for a proper allocation during the ensuing year capital program the mayor shall submit for a consideration to the board of aldermen any capital budget request or program deemed advisable  provided however that any such capital budget request or program submitted to the board of aldermen by the mayor shall be first submitted to the planning commission accompanied by substantiating information concerning need and cost the planning commission shall review and make its written recommendations to the mayor not later than thirty 30 days after receipt of the mayors request the mayor then shall submit to the board of aldermen the capital budget request with his recommendations together with those recommendations of the planning commission not later than thirty 30 days after receipt of same from the planning commission the board of aldermen may enact such capital programs as it deems appropriate for the general welfare of the city bonded debt the city of west monroe is empowered to incur bonded and other types of indebtedness in accordance with the constitution and the laws of this state procurement procurement of all property supplies materials services etc shall be under a system of central purchasing shall be in accordance with applicable state law the policy of the mayor and board of aldermen administrative requirements and shall be in accordance with established standards and specifications state law reference public contracts rs  et seq miscellaneous a all franchise or indeterminate permits shall be awarded only after properly advertised sic and public hearings franchises and indeterminate permits shall be awarded only for monetary or valuable consideration b the city clerk and such other employees as the mayor and board of aldermen may require shall be bonded in such amounts as required by state law employee bonding shall be a city expense article vii  general provisions legal process legal process against the city shall be served upon the mayor appointments all appointments of officers officials or employees unless provided for otherwise herein or by applicable state law shall be made by the mayor appointment approval appointments and approval of appointments recommended by the mayor which require board of aldermen action shall be by majority vote of the board of aldermen board and commission pay all members of the boards and commissions provided for by this charter or by ordinance shall serve without pay or compensation except that by ordinance the board of aldermen may authorize reimbursement of members for actual expenses incurred on official business of the city prohibitions any officer official board member or employee of the city who has a substantial financial interest direct or indirect or by reason of ownership of stock in any corporation in any contract with the city or in the sale of any land material supplies or services to the city or to a contractor supplying the city shall make known that interest and shall refrain from voting upon or otherwise participating in his capacity as a city officer official board member or employee in the making of such sale or in the making of performance of such contract any city officer official board member or employee who willfully conceals such a substantial financial interest or willfully violates the requirements of this section shall be guilty of malfeasance in office or position and shall forfeit his office or position violation of this section with the knowledge express or implied of the person or corporation contracting with or making a sale to the city shall render the contract or sale voidable by the mayor and the board of aldermen facsimile signature facsimile signatures are authorized for negotiable indebtedness signing rs   continuation in office any appointed or elected official or officer of the city shall continue in office until his successor has been appointed or elected and qualified this section shall not prohibit a valid resignation of an elected official or a valid resignation or dismissal of an appointed official or officer recall a the mayor or any member of the board of aldermen may be removed from office by the electors of the city recall process the procedure for a recall shall be the same as is provided in the general laws of this state b if in a recall election the majority of those voting vote for recall the officer named in the recall petition shall be ipso facto removed from office and the vacancy thereby created shall be filled as is the case of ordinary public disaster that incapacitates the mayor and a majority of the board of aldermen the remaining members of the government may act on an emergency basis and appoint such other officials as are elections shall be held as soon as it is judicially determined that conditions permit their being held state law reference emergency interim local executive succession act rs  et seq transitional of each calendar year such notice shall include the dates times and places of such meetings the board shall give written public notice of any regular special or rescheduled meeting no later than twentyfour 24 hours before the meeting such notice shall include the agenda date time and place of the meeting provided that upon approval of twothirds  23  of the members present the board may take up a matter not on the agenda in cases of extraordinary emergency such notice shall not be required  however the board shall give such notice of the meeting as it deems appropriate and circumstances permit b written public notice given by the board shall include but need not be limited to 1 posting a copy of the notice at the principal office of the board or if no such office exists at the building in which the meeting is to be held  or by publication of the notice in an official journal of the board no less than twentyfour 24 hours before the meeting 2 mailing a copy of the notice to any member of the news media who requests notice of such meetings  any such member of the news media shall be given notice of all meetings in the same manner as is given to members of the board state law reference similar provisions rs  order of business the order of business for each meeting of the board shall be as set forth on the agenda as prepared and with notice provided in accordance with state law  rules of procedure a at the request of the mayor or any board member all motions shall be reduced to writing b a motion to reconsider any of the proceedings of the board shall not be entertained unless it is made by a member who previously voted in the majority c no motion shall be debated or put until it is seconded and stated by the mayor it is then and not until then in possession of the board and cannot be withdrawn but by leave of the board d a motion to adjourn shall be in order at any time except as follows 1 when repeated without intervening business or discussion  2 when made as an interruption of a member while speaking  3 when the previous question has been ordered  or 4 while a vote is being taken a motion to adjourn is debatable only as to the time to which the meeting is adjourned e when a question is under debate no motion shall be received but 1 to adjourn  2 to lay on the table  3 for the previous question  4 to postpone to a day certain  5 to commit  6 to amend  or 7 to postpone indefinitely  which several motions shall have precedence in the order they stand arranged f when a proper motion is made but information is wanted the motion is to postpone to a day certain g in the case of matters claiming present attention for which it is desired to reserve for more suitable occasion the order is a motion to lay on the table  the matter may then be called for at any time if the proposition may need further consideration at the hands of a committee the motion is to refer to a committee but if it needs but a few and simple amendments the board shall proceed to consider and amend at once h on an amendments being moved a member who has spoken on the main question may speak again to the amendment i the question is to be put first on the affirmative and then on the negative side after the affirmative part of the question has been put any member who has not spoken before to the question may arise and speak before the negative is put j when a question has been moved and seconded and has been put by the presiding officer in the affirmative and negative it cannot be debated unless under motion for reconsideration other act of god or force which disrupts or threatens to disrupt the normal activities of the community  or 4 the occurrence of multiple acts of arson or of any acts which unduly alarm or threaten the public  the mayor or in his absence the mayor pro tempore may declare a state of emergency to exist within the corporate limits of the city the state of emergency shall be declared by proclamation signed by the mayor and posted on the main door of the city hall and shall be legally effective immediately upon posting the proclamation shall be in substantially the following language it has been determined that here state the event giving rise to the emergency has occurred within the corporate limits of the city of west monroe louisiana and that accordingly a state of emergency does in fact exist i therefore proclaim a state of emergency and invoke the provisions of section 22002 of the ordinances city of west monroe louisiana b in the event a state of emergency is declared by the mayor or mayor pro tempore under the provisions of subsection a hereof the mayor or mayor pro tempore shall become vested with the following extraordinary powers which may be exercised at the discretion of such official 1 to establish a curfew to be effective within the corporate limits  2 to prohibit or regulate the sale of gasoline explosives dynamite or any other type of inflammable or explosive materials firearms or any other materials or supplies or any component parts thereof which could readily be utilized as weapons  3 to mobilize and deputize an auxiliary police force under the command of the mayor or mayor pro tem and the chief of police  4 to disperse assemblies or congregations of persons  and 5 to suspend issuance of parade permits c any orders issued by the mayor under his extraordinary powers during a declaration of a state of emergency shall be effective immediately with the posting of such orders upon the main door of the city hall or upon verbal communication by the mayor directly to the person or persons whom the order is intended to affect d the state of emergency shall legally end when the mayor determines that the peace and good order of the city are no longer threatened and declares this in a proclamation which shall be posted upon the main door of the city hall e any powers of auxiliary police as authorized under subsection b3 of this section shall only be exercised after mobilization by the mayor and shall immediately cease upon the proclamation of the end of the state of emergency f no person shall violate any order issued by the mayor fiscal affairs rs  et seq  et seq article a  financial administration community development procurement a the written procurement policy attached to is adopted and shall be used for the procurement of all goods and services related to the expenditure of funds related to the planning grant thereunder and future grants under the community development block grant program b the mayor on behalf of the city is authorized and directed to do any acts and sign any documents necessary and proper to implement this policy  2 11883 investment policy a general purpose the general purpose of this investment policy is 1 to develop and outline clear investment guidelines and objectives  2 to develop procedures and constraints for the investment process itself  and 3 to develop a consistent method of reporting and monitoring investments and their market value all policies and investment objectives and decisions shall reflect the primary mandate to manage public funds prudently b investment objective all investment objectives shall be governed by the following priority of goals safety of principal liquidity and yield in addition all investments must qualify as acceptable and lawful under all applicable state and federal laws particularly including but not limited to the provisions of rs  as from time to time amended the city may opt to create separate investment accounts in order to segregate activity related to a specific purpose it is understood that the specific investment guidelines may vary from account to account depending on the designated use for each pool of funds each account that is managed separately should have its own set of investment guidelines that specifically state the types of investments to be used the maximum maturity of the allowable investments and any other limitation such investment guidelines shall be developed by the finance director and approved by the mayor 1 safety of principal safety of principal is the foremost objective of the investment program investments shall be undertaken in a manner that seeks to ensure the preservation of capital in the overall portfolio the objective will be to mitigate credit risk and interest rate risk while avoiding the erosion of principal by inflation a credit risk permissible investments shall be limited to those permitted by the provisions of rs  as from time to time amended or as expressly otherwise allowed or provided by law the city shall not be permitted to invest in mutual or trust funds except for permitted money market mutual funds the city shall not invest over twentyfive 25 percent of its total portfolio with the same issuer to decrease the possibility of credit risk unless it issuer is backed by the full faith and credit of the us government the city shall not invest in corporate bonds the city may invest funds with lamp the louisiana asset management pool b interest rate risk interest rate risk shall be mitigated by i structuring the investment portfolio so that securities mature to meet cash requirements for anticipated demands thereby avoiding the need to sell securities on the open market prior to maturity and ii by stipulating that the maximum maturity of any single security in the city investment portfolio can not exceed three 3 years longer term securities may only be used for a specific pool of funds such as funds held for construction purposes or bond reserve funds iii inflation risk inflation risk will be minimized use of permissible investments that are shorter than or equal to the maximum allowable maturity of three 3 years 2 liquidity the investment portfolio shall remain sufficiently liquid to meet all operating requirements that may be reasonably anticipated by the finance director of the city a minimum of five 5 percent of the total investment portfolio shall be held in cash money market funds or lamp furthermore since all possible cash demands cannot be anticipated the portfolio should consist largely of securities with active secondary or resale markets 3 yield the investment portfolio shall be designed with the objective of attaining a fair rate of return throughout budgetary and economic cycles taking into account the investment risk constraints and liquidity needs in order to compare the rate of return of the investment portfolio to the market return throughout budgetary and economic cycles the investment portfolio will be benchmarked against an available benchmark that is reflective of the investment portfolio composition and characteristics however return on investment is of least importance compared to the safety and liquidity objectives described above c standards of care 1 prudence the standard of prudence to be used by investment officials and investment management firms shall be first and foremost to comply with louisiana state law in addition the standard shall be the prudent person standard as defined in louisiana law and shall be applied in the context of managing an overall portfolio investment officers acting in accordance with written procedures and this investment policy and exercising due diligence shall be relieved of personal responsibility for an individual securitys credit risk or market price changes provided deviations from expectations are reported in a timely fashion and any required action is carried out in accordance with the terms of this policy investments shall be made with judgment and care under circumstances then prevailing which persons of prudence discretion and intelligence exercise in the management of their own affairs not for speculation but for investment considering the probable safety of their capital as well as the probable income to be derived 2 ethics and conflicts of interest elected officials officers and employees of the city involved in the investment process shall at all times comply with louisiana state law governing ethics for public officials and public employees elected officials officers and employees involved in the investment process shall refrain from personal business activity that could conflict with the proper execution and management of the investment program or that could impair their ability to make impartial decisions elected officials employees and investment officials shall disclose any material interest in financial institutions with which they conduct business they shall further disclose any personal financialinvestment positions that could be related to the performance of the investment portfolio employees and officers shall refrain from undertaking personal investment transactions with the same brokers with whom business is conducted on behalf of their entity 3 delegation of authority authority to manage the investment program is granted to the mayor and the director of finance the primary responsibility for the operation of the investment program is hereby delegated to the director of finance who shall carry out established written procedures and internal controls for the operation of the investment program consistent with this investment policy no person may engage in an investment transaction except as provided under the terms of this policy and the procedures established by the mayor and the city the director of finance shall be responsible for all transactions undertaken and shall establish a system of controls to regulate the activities of subordinate officials and his designees the city reserves the right to select a qualified investment management firm to act as the investment manager on behalf of and for the benefit of the city the employment of an investment management firm shall be done by contract and approved by the city in accordance with its best business interests in mind any investment transactions undertaken by the investment management firm shall be conducted in such a manner as to ensure that the city obtains the best purchase or sale price possible while maintaining high ethical standards in soliciting price quotes from brokerdealers should the city chose to employ the services of an investment management firm to act as the investment manager or seek the investment management advice of a brokerdealer the investment management firm and their representatives andor the brokerdealer and their representative brokers should have expertise in the types of securities allowable under the louisiana statutes the investment management firm andor each broker with whom the city shall be charged with having full knowledge of the citys investment objectives and investment policy as well as the investment statutes of the state of louisiana competitive bidding will be used and documented for all sale transactions 4 safekeeping and custody the city shall utilize the services of a qualified financial institution or a security brokerdealer to provide custodial services for its investment portfolio security brokerdealers may provide custodial services provided that the brokerdealer meets a minimum capital requirement of twentyfive million dollars $2500000000 and has been in business for at least five 5 years city may select a qualified institution that offers combined services of investment management and custodial services provided such firm meets or exceeds the qualifications above an annual review of the financial condition and registration of the investment manager andor the brokerdealers and the custodial services provider will be conducted by the director of finance 5 internal controls the director of finance is responsible for establishing and maintaining an internal control structure designed to ensure that the assets of the entity are protected from loss theft or misuse the internal control structure shall be designed to provide reasonable assurance that these objectives are met accordingly the director of finance shall establish a process for annual independent review by an external auditor to assure compliance with policies and procedures the internal controls shall address the following points a investment suitability purchased securities are in compliance with louisiana state law and the statutes that govern the investments of louisiana political subdivisions and are in compliance with the city investment policy statement b control of collusion collusion is a situation where two 2 or more employees are working in conjunction to defraud their employer c custodial safekeeping purchased securities including appropriate collateral shall be placed with a qualified regulated custodial agency separate from the issuer of the security for custodial safekeeping d avoidance of physical delivery securities book entry securities are much easier to transfer and account for since actual delivery of a document never takes place delivered securities must be properly safeguarded against loss or destruction the potential for fraud and loss increases with physically delivered securities louisiana community bank certificates of deposit are exempt of this e clear delegation of authority to subordinate staff members f written confirmation is required for all trades and wire transfers due to the potential for error and improprieties arising from telephone transactions all telephone transactions should be supported by written communications and approved by the appropriate person written communications may be via fax but the safekeeping institution should have a list of authorized signatures g development of a wire transfer agreement with the lead bank andor the appointed custodial agency this agreement should outline the various controls security provisions and delineate responsibilities of each party making and receiving wire transfers 6 delivery versus payment all trades where applicable will be executed by delivery versus payment dvp this ensures that securities are deposited in the eligible financial institution simultaneously with the release of funds securities will be held by the custodian selected by the city as evidenced by safekeeping receipts or by monthly asset statements d financial reporting and portfolio review 1 responsibilities of the director of finance if the city determines that it is in their best interest to seek the investment management advice of a brokerdealer the director of finance shall prepare an investment report on a quarterly basis or more frequently at the request of the city or its external auditor that provides adequate detail as to the investment activity purchases sales income unrealized gainslosses weighted average yield to maturity etc occurring during the time frame of the report at all times the director of finance shall maintain adequate documentation supporting all transaction activity and the valuation of the investment securities for review by the external auditor 2 responsibilities of the investment management firm if the city determines that it is in their best interest to hire an investment management firm to act as investment manager the investment management firm shall provide a monthly report to the director of finance of all investment activity that gives adequate information about the following a all purchase and sale transactions occurring during the time period b maturity dates of each security in order to assess the credit risk and interest rate risk of each security as well as the portfolio as a whole c the income loss derived from each investment security and the investment portfolio as a whole including the amount of unrealized gains and losses on the investment securities resulting from the appreciation or depreciation of the market value as compared to cost d weighted average yield tomaturity of the investments of the portfolio e the percentage of the total portfolio that each type of investment security represents f the relative performance of the investment portfolio versus the appropriate benchmark the investment management firm shall plan to meet with the director of finance on as needed andor as requested to discuss the status of the portfolio telephone consultations and email transmissions shall be acceptable forms of communication unless the city requires otherwise additionally if requested the investment management firm will present investment performance results on an annual basis to the city or the city finance committee or both at the request of the city or the city finance committee or both the investment management firm must make themselves available with appropriate notice for additional meetings 3 performance standards the investment portfolio will be managed in accordance with the parameters specified in this policy in order to compare the rate of return of the investment portfolio to the market return throughout budgetary and economic cycles the city may compare the investment portfolio of the city against an available benchmark that is reflective of the investment portfolio composition and characteristics portfolio performance should be compared to appropriate benchmarks on a regular basis and analyzed within the context of all the risk constraints on the portfolio 4 marking to market a statement of the market value of the portfolio including current credit risk information disclosing the credit quality ratings of the individual securities in the portfolio shall be issued at least quarterly this will ensure that the minimal amount of review has been performed on the investment portfolio in terms of value and subsequent price volatility an independent pricing source is an important part of a sound investment process the custodial agent of the investment securities shall provide independent pricing on a regular basis should broker pricing be required for some securities such as mortgages the custodial agent shall verify the accuracy other market pricing mechanism such as bloomberg financial services if the director of finance is managing the portfolio heshe shall obtain an independent pricing source if broker pricing is all that is available two 2 brokers should be used to price all securities the average of the prices obtained for each security should be used for reporting purposes e policy 1 exemption no investments shall be exempt from this policy 2 amendment any changes must be approved by the city upon the recommendation of the mayor and the finance director  4996   6915 secs 2400324010  reserved bridges public ways or other immovable property owned or controlled by the city nor unnecessarily damage or impair those streets roads controlled by the city c repair of damages atmos shall at its own expense repair any and all damages caused by atmos to any streets roads highways alleys bridges public ways or other immovable property owned or controlled by the city and shall restore as nearly as practicable such property to substantially its condition immediately prior to the incident causing such damage all in accordance with the appropriate state construction and other code standards atmos shall commence such repairs immediately upon completion of the work or activity in which atmos was involved at the time the damage occurred and shall complete such repairs as promptly as possible atmos shall not unnecessarily or unreasonably damage impair or obstruct the streets roads highways alleys sidewalks and public grounds and atmos shall at its own expense without unreasonable delay make all necessary repairs to remedy any damage or remove any obstruction caused by its operations hereunder all in accordance with the appropriate state construction and other code standards atmos shall obtain all necessary permits or approvals for construction maintenance and operations  provided however that this provision shall not apply to any requirements for such permits or approvals that are adopted or amended subsequent to the date of this enactment and that as so adopted or amended have a material effect on atmos rights or obligations pursuant to this franchise or on atmos cost of providing service pursuant to this franchise and further provided that atmos shall not be required to pay any fee or charge to the city in connection with any such permit or approval d conduct of work and activities atmos shall use reasonable care and precautions in conducting its work and activities in order to avoid and prevent damage or injury to persons or property and shall hold save harmless and indemnify the city from all damages losses andor expense including cost of defense attributable to the negligence or fault of atmos its agents or employees while exercising any of the rights and privileges granted in this chapter e extension of gas system atmos shall at its sole expense extend its gas system in order to serve additional consumers in accordance with the standard terms and conditions for natural gas service as now approved or as may hereafter be approved by the louisiana public service commission f service to new areas if during the term of this franchise the boundaries of the city are expanded the city will promptly notify atmos in writing of any geographic areas annexed by the city during the term hereof annexation notice any such annexation notice shall be sent to a force majeure notwithstanding anything expressed or implied to the contrary contained in this chapter in the event atmos is prevented wholly or partially from complying with any obligation or undertaking contained herein by reason of any event of force majeure then while so prevented compliance with such obligations or undertakings shall be suspended the term force majeure as used herein shall mean any cause not reasonably within atmos control and includes but is not limited to acts of god strikes lockouts wars terrorism riots orders or decrees of any lawfully constituted federal state or local body contagions or contaminations hazardous to human life or health fires storms floods washouts explosions breakages or accidents to machinery or lines of pipe inability to obtain or the delay in obtaining rightsofway materials supplies or labor permits temporary failures of gas supply or necessary repair maintenance or replacement of facilities used in the performance of the
