 burglary and robbery alarms a definitions alarm system any assembly of equipment or devices mechanical or electrical which is designed arranged or used for the detection of a hazardous condition or an unauthorized entry or attempted entry into a building structure or facility or for alerting persons of a hazardous condition or the commission of an unlawful act to or within a building structure or facility and which emits a sound or transmits a signal or message when activated to which the police department of the city is expected to respond but this definition shall not include an alarm system installed in a vehicle or a fire alarm alarm user any person as defined in in control of any building structure or facility or a portion thereof wherein an alarm system is maintained however a church or other religious organization or any other nonprofit corporation not engaged in a regular business activity shall be exempt from the provisions of subsection e of this section false alarm a signal from an alarm system eliciting a response by police when an investigation indicates no criminal activity occurred to cause the alarm signal or it is otherwise determined that a situation requiring a response by the police did not in fact exist police the police department of the city b alarm system operating requirements 1 an alarm system shall be adjusted to suppress false indications due to a transient pressure changes in water pipes b flashes of light c wind noise caused by rattling or vibration of windows or doors d vehicular noise e electrical power fluctuations f other forces unrelated to an actual emergency 2 all alarm users shall provide the police with the name telephone number and address of at least one authorized person who shall be available to respond and shall arrive at the building structure or facility where an alarm has been activated within thirty 30 minutes when requested to do so by the police all alarm users shall promptly notify the police of any change in the designation or manner of contacting an authorized person 3 audible alarms shall be adjusted so that the alarm will sound for no longer than thirty 30 minutes and must be reset before sounding again c false alarms 1 whenever an alarm system is activated in the city thereby requiring an emergency response to the location by the police and the police do respond a police officer on the scene of the activated alarm system shall inspect the area protected by the system and shall determine whether the alarm was a false alarm however an alarm user shall not be held accountable for a false alarm caused by a natural or manmade catastrophe b vandalism c telephone line outage d severe weather conditions causing damage to the premises the alarm user shall have the burden of proving these causes 2 if the police officer at the scene of the activated alarm system determines the alarm to be a false alarm the officer shall make a report of the false alarm and if the alarm user is determined to be held accountable a notification of the false alarm shall be mailed or delivered to the alarm user at the address of the alarm system installation location the determination of the police officer may be appealed to the chief of police the decision of the chief of police shall be the final administrative decision however nothing contained herein shall prevent an alarm user from pursuing any matter that is the subject of this section in any of the several courts of this state 3 the chief of police or his designee shall have the right to inspect any alarm system on the premises to which a response has been made and he may cause an inspection of such system to be made at any reasonable time thereafter to determine whether the alarm system is being operated in conformity with the provisions of this section d assistance persons in about or who respond by coming to the site of an alarm activation shall obey all reasonable requests for assistance by the police including but not limited to identifying themselves to police officers or leaving the building upon request such persons will also promptly notify the police of any and all hazards to the officer which exist within the building structure facility or area e service fees for false alarm notifications 1 the alarm user shall be charged a service fee for false alarms pursuant to the following schedule a one 3 no charge a warning will be included in the notification to the alarm user b four 4 to six 6 twentyfive dollars $2500 each occurrence c six 6 to twentyfour 24 fifty dollars $5000 each occurrence d twentyfive 25 or more two hundred dollars $20000 each occurrence 2 alarms will be counted for the twelve 12 month period previous to the date of any false alarm 3 the chief of police shall have the ability to waive any service fee for any false alarm based upon any facts or in any situation he deems appropriate  101089 editors note of adopted oct 10 198 enacted provisions and substantial justice done the particulars of such modification when granted or allowed and the decision of the chief of the bureau of fire prevention thereon shall be entered upon the records of the department and a signed copy shall be furnished the applicant  appeals whenever the chief of the bureau of fire prevention shall disapprove an application or refuse to grant a permit applied for provisions of that fire prevention code nor shall any person violate or fail to timely comply with any order issued by the bureau of fire prevention thereunder no person shall construct any structure differing in any manner from the detailed statement of specifications and plans submitted and approved by the office of the fire marshal of the state of louisiana if such approval was required nor differing in any manner from any certificate or permit issued either under the provisions of the fire prevention code or by some other department or agency in reliance on any approval of the fire prevention bureau the imposition of a penalty for any violation shall not excuse that or any other violation or thereafter allow any violation to continue all persons shall be required to correct or remedy each violation promptly following notification of the violation by the fire prevention bureau when not otherwise specified each fifteen 15 days during which a violation is thereafter maintained shall constitute a separate offense as to each violation b should a violation be determined by the bureau of fire prevention to have the potential to comprise a significant risk of harm to person or property the fire prevention bureau shall have the right to require the structure to be immediately vacated to require all natural gas and electrical service to the structure be immediately halted and to require the structures remain vacated by all persons until those violations have been corrected except for those persons as the fire prevention bureau shall allow entry in order to undertake any and all necessary actions to eliminate the violations c the failure of the owner of the structure and of any person utilizing the structure as a tenant or other occupant to have fully and properly corrected any violation within the deadline provided in the second notice of the violation shall result in the following costs to the responsible person i fifty dollar $5000 fee for the fire prevention bureau then providing the owner and any occupant with an updated written notification and listing of all remaining violations  and ii one hundred dollar $10000 fee for each subsequent reinspection and written notification until all violations are corrected no more than one reinspection shall occur each fifteen 15 days the determination of the responsible person whether the owner or tenant or other occupant shall be determined by the fire prevention bureau based upon the standards set out in the fire prevention code and the particular facts and circumstances of the violation d notifications shall be sufficient to an owner if presented personally or to any shareholder registered agent partner member manager of a limited liability company officer director trustee or to any managerial or supervisory person of the owner on the premises at the time of delivery notifications shall be sufficient to a tenant or other occupant if presented personally or to any shareholder registered agent partner member manager of a limited liability company officer director trustee or to any managerial or supervisory person of the tenant or occupant on the premises at the time of delivery e penalty for violations reserved    61317 nuisance fire alarms a a nuisance alarm is any unwanted activation of a signaling system or an alarm initiating device in response to a stimulus or adequate and effective method in perpetuity of financing and operating those cemetery facilities presently owned by the city and any such facilities which the city may hereafter decide it is necessary to acquire or create exhibit a ii 2877   91190 duration the trust is to be perpetual in existence except and only insofar as same may be terminated as outlined under section 52036 exhibit a iii 2877   91190 use of property under trust a as to those pieces or parcels of immovable property transferred to the trust or as may hereafter be acquired by the trust for use as cemetery facilities the board shall develop a plan providing that all or any portion of said land is divided into burial plots of a size and character to be determined by the board b the board may also designate parts of the land to be used for sidewalks aisles gardens lighting storage facilities chapels sexton or caretaker buildings streets outside fences drainage or other buildings structures or uses as the board deems necessary for the proper operation and maintenance of a cemetery facility c the burial plots shall conform to any and all valid laws ordinances or regulations concerning the size depth spacing and other safety or health characteristics of burial plots located in cemeteries in the state exhibit a iv 2877   91190 sale of burial plots interment service and care the board shall endeavor to sell permit or the owners of burial plots with an interment service and the maintenance of the gravesite including provisions for perpetual care the consideration and terms of such contracts shall be established by the board further the board may establish any type of installment cash discount or other payment plans or programs as it deems in the best interest of the successful operation of the hasley cemetery trust fund hereinafter referred to as the trust fund b the trust fund shall be invested by the board in securities of the united states government any state parish county or municipality or shares of any savings and loan association located within this state whose share accounts are insured by the federal savings and loan insurance corporation having a fair market value equal to said amount of cash on the date of deposit exhibit a vii  2877   91190 purpose of trust fund  restrictions on use of principal a it is the purpose and intent of establishment of the trust the board should be less than the income interest dividends fees or other monies generated by investment of the trust fund the board may either reinvest said excess income into the trust fund thus board to defray the operating and maintenance expenses of the cemetery exhibit a xiv 2877   91190 board of trustees a established there is hereby created and established a board of trustees for the hasley cemetery trust for the city referred to in this section as the board b composition  officers  minutes of meetings the board shall consist of the mayor and board of aldermen and their legally appointed or elected successors the mayor shall be the executive director of the board and shall preside at all meetings of the board the clerk of the city shall maintain an accurate record of the minutes of the meetings of the board c terms each member of the board shall serve as a trustee of the trust so long as he shall occupy the position of mayor or a member of the board of aldermen upon his vacating said position his membership as a trustee of the trust shall terminate and his successor in the position of mayor or member of the board of aldermen shall assume the office of trustee of said trust d compensation the members of the board of trustees of the trust shall serve without compensation or pay and shall be entitled only to reimbursement for reasonable and legitimate expenses incurred in the performance of their duties as trustees of the trust e meeting  quorum  majority needed to act the board shall meet in regular session at least once every three 3 months the board may adopt rules or regulations calling for more frequent meetings the initial meeting of the board shall be held at a time and place to be decided by the executive director of said board but not less than seven 7 days from the establishment of this trust the executive director of the trust may call the board into special session at any time upon giving the members of the board at least twentyfour 24 hours notice of such a meeting a quorum of the board shall be necessary to transact any business of the board a quorum of the board shall consist of a majority of the members of the board a majority vote of a quorum shall be necessary in order for the board to exercise any of the powers vested in said board each member of the board shall have a single vote excluding the executive director who shall be entitled to cast one vote in the event of a tie vote except as above enumerated the board shall provide for its organization and working procedure f powers the board is hereby vested with the general power to direct the operation and maintenance of those cemetery facilities under its control and the operation of the trust fund including but not limited to the following powers 1 to sell hypothecate alienate transfer or lease any and all real or movable property transferred to or acquired by the trust 2 to enter into any and all manner of contracts 3 to purchase or lease any and all manner of property both movable and immovable machinery tools supplies goods and services which the board deems necessary to the proper and efficient maintenance and administration of the trust 4 to procure insurance or indemnity agreements 5 to pay all reasonable and legitimate expenses incurred by board members in connection with the managing of cemetery facilities 6 to hire and pay the wages of employees to maintain care for or administer the property subject to the trust 7 to accept donation of real or movable property or services made to the trust provided there is no condition thereto inconsistent with the purposes herein set forth 8 to borrow money 9 to request and decline funds goods or services appropriated to the trust by any governmental authority 10 to administer and supervise the investment of any funds accounts or other investments mandated or permitted in this trust including the hiring of professional investment managers and banking trust officers g assumption of prior obligations within a reasonable period after its initial meeting the board shall endeavor to develop and implement a plan whereby the board would undertake to assume the responsibility for those contracts obligations and agreements which presently exist between the city and other persons in relation to the operations or maintenance of cemetery facilities by the city the board shall develop whatever system to accomplish this that it deems in the best interest of the trust and the continued operation of the cemetery facilities h financial records the board shall cause to be maintained a set of financial records showing in detail the receipts and expenditures or disbursement of funds by the board i budget within thirty 30 days prior to the end of a current fiscal year the board shall develop and adopt a comprehensive budget covering the forthcoming fiscal year j annual report the board shall file in writing an annual report including the financial condition of the trust fund with the governmental authority of the city the annual report shall be filed within ninety 90 days after the end of the fiscal year the annual report shall include the following 1 a summary of the activities of the board over the period covered  2 any recommendations for changes or modifications in the trust document  3 any recommendations for actions by the governmental authority of the city in relation to the trust or to the acquisition funding or operation of cemetery facilities by the city  4 a copy of the financial reports for the immediately preceding year  and 5 an itemized budget prepared by the board outlining the anticipated revenue and expenses covering the year immediately following that period covered by the last annual report k annual accounting and audit the board shall cause to be prepared an annual accounting of all funds received and disbursed by the board this accounting shall be conducted within sixty 60 days of the end of the fiscal year of the city and shall cover a period of one year and same to coincide with the fiscal year employed by the city for accounting purposes the annual accounting shall contain a detailed statement of all income interest dividends or fees generated or earned during the immediate preceding fiscal year by the investment of all funds held by the board and the manner amount and ultimate deposit and expenditure of such income interest dividends or fees by the board and all other financial attributes engaged in during the period covered by the accounting exhibit a ixi 2877   91190 modification termination of governmental authority of west monroe louisiana that this trust shall be maintained in perpetuity upon the termination of the trust the governmental authority of the city shall cause to be conducted a final audit and accounting of all assets and liabilities of whatever nature held by the trust at the time of termination of the trust and the assets therefrom shall become the property of the city c their administration for any action or inaction in the conduct administration or management of the trust or for funds or properties of the trust save and except only for willful misconduct or bad faith there shall be no liability or responsibilities for errors of judgment or depreciation of investments exhibit a iii 2877   91190 severability it is intended that the provisions parts sections other provisions parts sections or subsections or the trust document which can be given effect without the invalid provisions parts sections or subsections or applications and to that end the fishing in the kiroli park recreational area will follow louisiana wildlife and fisheries rules and regulations and the rules and regulations of the kiroli park recreational area the use of nets yoyos or trot lines in the kiroli park recreational area is prohibited c boating prohibited all boats and other aquatic recreational equipment are prohibited in the kiroli park recreational area d archery prohibited bows and arrows crossbows and all similar instrumentalities are prohibited in the kiroli park recreational area e swimming prohibited all swimming is prohibited within the kiroli park recreational area f motor vehicles all motor vehicles utilized in the kiroli park recreational area must meet all motor vehicle standards of the state of louisiana and the city of west monroe including those regarding licensing of vehicles lighting inspection and safety stickers and licensing of drivers speed limits and other traffic control devices shall be established within the kiroli park recreational area in the same manner as established throughout the city of west monroe and shall have the same force and effect g restriction of operation of vehicles operation and parking of motor vehicles motorized bikes and bicycles shall be restricted to designated parking areas and hard road surfaces excluding walkways and trails the use of any motorized or unmotorized vehicle of any type is prohibited on walkways or trail areas except when utilized by authorized park personnel h operation of vehicles no person shall operate any motor vehicle motorized bike or bicycle in a careless negligent or reckless manner so as to endanger any person or property all persons operating a vehicle must abide by all signs and notifications including those which indicate direction of traffic flow speed limits parking areas and handicapped parking restrictions i horseback riding except as provided by the rules and regulations of the kiroli park recreational area horses mules donkeys and similar livestock are prohibited in the kiroli park recreational area j restriction on fires fires shall be confined to fireplaces grills or other facilities designated for this purpose open camp fires or bonfires are prohibited k sanitation it shall be unlawful to dump or deposit refuge in or around the kiroli park recreational area all trash must be deposited in garbage or trash containers provided for that purpose or removed from the kiroli park recreational area premises l protection of vegetation no wildflower tree or shrub in the kiroli park recreational area shall be picked cut broken or otherwise damaged in any way the destruction injury defacement or removal of any object natural or manmade from within the kiroli park recreational area is strictly prohibited m damaging public property prohibited no person shall willfully deface destroy or attempt to deface or destroy any structure or other public property in kiroli park recreational area n noise improper conduct prohibited loud or intrusive noise music or conduct which is dangerous or annoying to any person is prohibited the determination of loud or intrusive noise music or conduct shall be made by park personnel o alcoholic beverages except as expressly provided by the rules and regulations of the kiroli park recreational area possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages within the kiroli park recreational area is strictly prohibited p fees it shall be unlawful to avoid or attempt to avoid payment of any or all fees charged for entrance into the kiroli park recreational area or for the use of the kiroli park recreational area or any of its facilities q interference with park employees any interference by any person with the actions of the employees of the kiroli park recreational area including but not limited to the enforcement of the rules and regulations of the kiroli park recreational area is unlawful r additional rules and regulations additional rules and regulations and exceptions to the rules established in this section may be established from time to time by the mayor or his designee s penalties all crimes and offenses established by the state of louisiana and by the city of west monroe shall apply within the kiroli park recreational area however in addition thereto and not in limitation of those crimes and offenses of general applicability any person or persons violating any provision of these rules or of the rules and regulations for the kiroli park recreational area established by the mayor of the city of west monroe and duly posted within the kiroli park recreational area shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be punished by a fine not exceeding three hundred dollars $30000 or imprisonment for not more than ninety 90 days or both park personnel shall additionally be empowered to immediately eject any person from within the kiroli park recreational area for the violation of any provision of these rules or of the rules and regulations of the kiroli park recreational area any person resisting such ejectment or thereafter returning to the kiroli park recreational area without express permission to do so shall be installation and repair where appropriate of the city water distribution system and sewerage collection system only and shall meet the appropriate minimum requirements established by the american society for testing and materials astm 1916 race street philadelphia pennsylvania 191 and the appropriate minimum requirements of the american waterworks association awwa 6666 west quincy avenue denver colorado 80235 1 specifications for pvc plastic water pipe pvc plastic pipe joints and fittings for water in sizes up to but not including four 4 inches shall conform to the following specifications a polyvinyl chloride plastic water pipe 1 all plastic water main furnished shall be of the polyvinyl chloride type and shall conform in all respects to commercial standards of the national sanitation foundation and bear its seal and approval as safe for potable water service 2 polyvinyl chloride pipe shall be manufactured from virgin polyvinyl chloride resin conforming to type 1 grade 1 resin of astm d1784 specification 3 all polyvinyl chloride plastic pipe shall have a minimum internal pressure rating of one hundred sixty 160 pounds per square inch at seventythree 73 degrees fahrenheit 4 all pipe shall have the manufacturers trade name the initials pvc the pressure rating and the national sanitation foundation seal of approval conspicuously marked on each length of pipe b joints 1 all polyvinyl chloride water pipe shall be furnished with a pushon plain end to bell type of joint the bell shall be of an integral part of the pipe unless the bell and pipe are factory assembled into a single unit using a solvent cement by the manufacturer each bell shall be supplied with a continuous rubber ring of uniform crosssection which will properly seat in a groove or shoulder of the bell provided for it 2 any lubricant used in the installation shall be as recommended by the pipe manufacturer and shall be nontoxic and approved by the national sanitation foundation as safe for water supply service c fittings 1 all fittings furnished for polyvinyl chloride pipe shall be made from polyvinyl chloride conforming to the specifications listed in a above all fittings shall be compatible with the pipe upon which they are installed and only standard manufactured fittings will be accepted 2 all polyvinyl chloride fittings shall be furnished with a pushon type joint if the fitting consists of one or more parts the parts shall be factory assembled into a single unit the different parts of the fitting shall be joined using a solvent cement the joining of the parts shall be so controlled and inspected to insure that a good solvent cement joint has been obtained 3 special adapters required to transition from polyvinyl chloride pipe to another type of pipe or to a valve or other appurtenance shall be of the type as recommended by the polyvinyl chloride pipe manufacturer 4 only standard manufactured adapters will be accepted all fittings shall be of the same or greater pressure ratings than the pipe 5 pvc plastic pipe joints and fittings for water in sizes four 4 inches and above shall conform to awwa c90075 latest revision and shall have a minimum pressure rating of one hundred fifty 150 pounds per square inch d flexible plastic all flexible plastic service pipe for service from the main line to the water meter shall be manufactured from ultrahigh molecular weight polyethylene defined by astm d1248 as pe type iii pe 3306 or polybutylene as defined by astm d2581 type ii pb2110 1 the pipe shall be made of all virgin material and conform to the standards of the national sanitation foundation 2 the pipe shall have a working pressure of one hundred sixty 160 pounds per square inch at seventythree and fourtenths 734 degrees fahrenheit and shall be capable of maintaining pressure of three hundred thirty 330 pounds per square inch at seventythree and fourtenths 734 degrees fahrenheit for one thousand 1000 hours the pipe may be furnished in the iron pipe or copper tubing size and shall be capable of cold flaring as no heating of the pipe will be permitted 3 pipe shall be permanently imprinted with manufacturers brand name pipe size commercial standard notation identification of the national sanitation foundation approval recommended working pressure and production code 4 all nonmetallic line must be installed with a noncorrosive metallic wire or tape placed directly over and on the center line of the facility for its entire length wire or tape must be connected to all fixtures and appurtenances a no 12 awg copper wire either insulated or bore will satisfy this requirement 2 specifications for abs and pvc plastic sewer pipe a abs plastic sewer pipe 1 solid wall pipe all pipe six 6 inches and smaller with the pipe manufacturers recommendations c fittings for abs plastic sewer pipes all fittings shall be standard manufactured fittings approved by the pipe manufacturer for use on his pipe all with a rubber ring the bell shall consist of an integral wall section with a solid cross section rubber ring factory assembled securely locked in place to prevent displacement f fittings for pvc deflection test for pvc gravity sewer pipe immediately after backfilling the contractor shall run a deflection test on all pvc sewer mains the contractor shall furnish an instrument or device suitable to measure the maximum fivepercent deflection of the main the proposed method of measuring deflection shall be submitted to the engineer for approval prior to starting construction at any time prior to acceptance the engineer may require the contractor to recheck any portion of the line that he feels may have had additional deflection since initial backfill any main which has deflection in excess of five 5 percent shall be rejected and the contractor shall remove the existing pipe and replace the main with new pipe with sufficient bedding and backfill to maintain the required deflection c astm above mentioned each certification shall be signed by an authorized agent of the seller or manufacturer d embedment notwithstanding any provision herein to the contrary the embedment of any titled the groundwater protection establishes a drinking water protection critical area around each water well serving an active public water system the underlying purpose and intent of these sections is to safeguard the health safety and lives of the public by protecting groundwater from contamination  41409   applicability these provisions and the drinking water protection critical areas created hereby shall apply to and include all new construction reconstruction or expansion of existing buildings and new or expanded uses these activitiesfacilitiesuses must comply with the requirements of both the drinking water protection critical areas and any applicable land use regulations or covenants public or private the provisions of the groundwater protection ordinance are distinct from and not a part of any land use regulations or covenants public or private that may exist in the city  41409   definitions abandoned water well a well whose use has been permanently discontinued  its pumping equipment has been permanently removed  the well is in such a state of disrepair that it cannot be used to supply water andor has the potential for transmitting surface contaminants into an aquifer  the well poses potential health or safety hazards or the well is in such a condition that it cannot be placed in the active standby or inactive status aboveground storage tank ast a vessel used to store petroleum products or chemicals that is fixed permanently in place stationary on foundations racks cradles or stilts or on the ground the term does not include tanks mounted on wheels trolleys skids pallets or rollers or produced substance storage tanks directly related to oil and gas production and gathering operations applicant person or persons applying for a special permit for a facility within the drinking water protection critical areas animal feedlotdairies a lot or facility other than an aquatic animal production facility where animals have been are or will be stabled season over any portion of the lot or facility aquifer a waterbearing rock sand or gravel layer that will yield water in a usable quantity to a well or spring class i well wells used to inject hazardous wastes or dispose of nonhazardous industrial waste and treated municipal sewage below the deepest underground source of drinking water class ii well wells used to inject fluids associated with the production of oil and natural gas or fluids and compounds used for enhanced hydrocarbon recovery these wells normally inject below the deepest underground source of drinking water usdw except in cases where the usdw contains producible quantities of oil or gas class iii well wells that inject fluids used in subsurface mining of minerals class v well wells not included in the other classes that inject nonhazardous fluid into or above an underground source of drinking water the seven major types of class v wells include drainage wells geothermal reinjection wells domestic wastewater disposal wells mineral and fossil fuel recovery related wells industrialcommercialutility disposal wells recharge wells and miscellaneous wells class v injection wells also include all largecapacity cesspools and motor vehicle waste disposal wells contamination the presence of a material that may cause or significantly contribute to a present or potential risk to human health safety welfare or that is present in groundwater resources or to the natural environment such that it degrades the quality of the resource so as to constitute a hazard andor impair its use delineation determining the outline or shape of a drinking water protection area drinking water protection area the area around a drinking water source such as a well or surface water intake such as delineated by the louisiana department of environmental quality as part of the source water assessment program this area is shown on source water assessment program maps and contains the drinking water protection critical area of special permit 1 the special permit granting authority spga for this chapter shall be the department of public water such special permit shall be granted if the spga determines in conjunction with office of planning and zoning that the intent of this chapter as well as its specific criteria is met the spga shall not grant a special permit under this section unless the petitioners application materials include in the spgas opinion sufficiently detailed definite and credible information to support positive findings in relation to the standards given in this section the spga shall document the basis for any departures from the recommendations of the other towncity boards or agencies in its decision 2 upon receipt of the special permit application the spga shall transmit one copy to the office of planning and zoning for their written recommendations the applicant shall furnish the necessary number of copies of the application 3 the spga may grant the required special permit only upon finding that the proposed use meets the prohibited uses standards as specified in section 710245 of this bylaw all federal state and local regulations and any regulations or guidelines adopted by the spga 4 the applicant shall file three 3 copies of a site plan and attachments the site plan shall be drawn at a proper scale as determined by the spga and be stamped by a professional engineer all additional submittals shall be prepared by qualified professionals the site plan and its attachments shall at a minimum include provisions to protect against the discharge of hazardous materials or wastes to the environment due to spillage accidental damage corrosion leakage or vandalism including spill containment and cleanup procedures  provisions for indoor secured storage of hazardous materials and wastes with impervious floor surfaces 5 appeals from denial of special permits shall be submitted in writing to the board of aldermen within thirty 30 days of receipt of denial the board of aldermen shall conduct a review and render a decision within fortyfive 45 days of receipt of appeal request unless extended by them such extension to be only until their next regularly scheduled meeting adverse decision of the board of aldermen shall be appealed to the state district court  41409   saving clause should any section or provision of this chapter be declared invalid such decision shall not affect the validity of the ordinance as a whole or any other part thereof and shall not invalidate any special permit previously issued thereunder  41409   complaints a based upon the determination that there is a violation of this chapter the city shall conduct an attempt at informal reconciliation with the violator as part of such informal reconciliation the jurisdiction shall 1 notify the violator by mail of the violation of this chapter and desire of the jurisdiction to correct the violation reconciliation the statement shall also indicate that should the violator refuse to allow the recommended corrective actions within the time set forth by the jurisdiction action may be taken to correct the violation and the violator will be billed for the cost of taking the corrective action 2 make a good faith effort to meet the violator and resolvecorrect the violation b if after taking the steps above and after a period of fifteen 15 days following the mailing of the notice of the violation the jurisdiction in good faith determines that the violator is unwilling to participate in informal reconciliation and take the corrective actions prescribed the jurisdiction shall notify the violator by mail of the termination of the informal reconciliation c the city may take corrective actions deemed necessary following fifteen 15 days after notifying the violator by mail of the notice of termination of the informal reconciliation and bill the violator for the reasonable cost of such action d citizen complaints the city is not limited to enforcing this chapter on citizen complaint the city may enforce this chapter on its own cognizance however any person may submit a verbal or written complaint alleging a violation of this chapter upon receipt of such complaint the city shall conduct an investigation of the allegations  41409   enforcement a civil this chapter may be enforced civilly by suit for injunctive relief or by any other appropriate civil remedy b criminal in lieu of a civil enforcement proceeding a person found in violation of this chapter shall be subject to the fines andor penalties provided in section 11008  41409 sewage collection 8201682020  reserved article c  junk debris and liquid wastes junk and debris prohibited a no owner or occupant of property in the city shall permit the abandoning or storage of all junk items including discarded or abandoned major appliances such as refrigerators freezers or ranges  all furniture not intended for outdoor use and other furniture not now capable of reasonable usage in the manner originally intended  or machinery including but not limited to lawn mowers of all types tractors motor vehicles not licensed for onroad use and bicycles  or dilapidated andor unsafe fencing or fencing which contributes in any way to another violation of this chapter  or other metal tin or other discarded items or yard debris on their premises which is perceptible from beyond the property the term junk items shall include boats and accessories  boat utility or other trailers  travel trailers and mobile homes  and similar items which although titled or registered with the state of louisiana are not motor vehicles the term yard debris shall include fallen trees or limbs unless cut and neatly stacked for use as firewood as well as accumulations of grasses weeds branches limbs and other vegetable matter whether alone or mixed with other items all such accumulations described above are hereby declared a nuisance and shall be removed by the owner of the property dilapidated shall as respect to fencing include use of an apparent accumulation of materials not originally intended for the purpose for which they are used b as an alternative to removal complete enclosure of such materials or items in buildings or within solid fences which totally obscure them from view are required and such fences cannot be constructed of dilapidated material and must be maintained in good repair c factors which may indicate that a junk item is a nuisance include but are not limited to the following 1 the junk item is partially dismantled partially disassembled or wrecked or lacks major mechanical or structural parts  2 the junk item is not now capable of reasonable usage in the manner in which it was originally intended  3 based upon the records of the city or from the condition of the junk item it is readily apparent that it is and has remained inoperable andor unused for a period in excess of ninety 90 days  4 the junk item is inoperable and no significant ongoing efforts have been undertaken with regard to restoring it to reasonable operability within the last sixty 60 days  5 the junk item is located in an area of a growth of weeds grass or other noxious vegetation over six 6 inches in height  6 the location or condition of the junk item makes it a possible breeding ground or harbor for mosquitos other insects rats snakes or other vermin  7 the junk item is a point of collection for pools or ponds of water  8 the junk item is point of collection of garbage food waste animal waste or other putrescent matter or of trash junk or similar collection of items alone or in the aggregate  9 the junk item has sharp or jagged parts or has sharp or otherwise dangerous edges or points of metal plastic or glass  10 the junk item has areas of confinement which cannot be operated from the interior of those areas  11 the junk item has been utilized by minors for recreational activities within the pervious sixty 60 days  12 the junk item is situated or located haphazardly or is in danger of falling or turning over  13 the junk item has an accumulation of factors that make it a health or safety hazard  and 14 there exists other factors which would cause a reasonable person to believe that the item is not capable of being safely andor legally used in its intended manner  91190   8905   91316 vermin notwithstanding the provisions of section 82021 no or legal holidays from date of posting notice the motor vehicle may be removed and disposed of by a tow truck operator on behalf of the city with all costs of towing and storage to be collected from the vehicle may result in the vehicle being removed by the city or by a tow truck operator on behalf of the city b if the nuisance motor vehicle is not removed within five 5 days not to include collected from the owner or lienholder retrieving the vehicle or from the sale or disposition of the vehicle as otherwise provided by law c a nuisance motor vehicle for the purposes of this section shall mean and include a motor vehicle where any one or more of the following factors are present and which in the aggregate evidence that the motor vehicle is not being used and maintained as an operating motor vehicle and the condition of the motor vehicle andor the surrounding area does not indicate that active ongoing efforts are underway to return the motor vehicle to operating condition within the immediate future the factors which may indicate that a motor vehicle is a nuisance motor vehicle include the following 1 the motor vehicle is partially dismantled partially disassembled or wrecked or lacks major mechanical or body parts  2 the motor vehicle is not capable of movement under its own power in the manner in which it was originally intended or is otherwise inoperable for use as a motor vehicle  3 based upon the records of the city or from the condition of the motor vehicle it is readily apparent that it is and has remained inoperable for a period in excess of thirty 30 days  4 the motor vehicle is inoperable and no significant ongoing efforts have been undertaken with regard to restoring it to reasonable operability within the last thirty 30 days  5 the motor vehicle has one or more tires missing or not reasonably inflated to the extent they are useable or has one or more broken or severely cracked windows  6 that the motor vehicle does not have a current license plate registration motor vehicle inspection sticker andor is not currently insured to the extent required under rs  shall all be factors tending to evidence that the motor vehicle is not currently operable in a legal manner and is not intended to be operating in a legal manner within the immediate future  7 the motor vehicle is located in an area of a growth of weeds grass or other noxious vegetation over six 6 inches in height  8 the location or condition of the motor vehicle makes it a possible breeding ground or harbor for mosquitos other insects rats snakes or other vermin  9 the motor vehicle is a point of collection for pools or ponds of water  10 the motor vehicle is a point of concentration of quantities of gas or oil or other flammable or explosive materials  11 the motor vehicle is point of collection of garbage food waste animal waste or other putrescent matter or of trash junk or similar collection of items alone or in the aggregate  12 the motor vehicle has sharp or jagged parts or has sharp or otherwise dangerous edges or points of metal plastic or glass  13 the motor vehicle has areas of confinement which cannot be operated from the interior of those areas  14 the motor vehicle has been utilized by minors for recreational activities within the previous sixty 60 days  15 the motor vehicle is situated or located haphazardly or is in danger of falling or turning over  and 16 the motor vehicle has an accumulation of factors that make it a health or safety hazard d in addition to the notification to be placed upon the windshield of the motor vehicle as provided above notice shall also be provided to the registered owner of the motor vehicle and any registered lienholders if such owner andor lienholders can be reasonably determined by us mail certified or registered mail at the address reflected by the records of the louisiana department of motor vehicles e this provision shall not apply to any motor vehicle 1 which is stored in such neat and orderly manner and in a location such that as to essentially all outward appearance the motor vehicle appears to be an operating motor vehicle and which motor vehicle does not otherwise standards litter receptacles procured and placed in public places as required by this article shall meet the following minimum standards 1 general specifications a the body of each litter receptacle shall be constructed of a minimum of twentyfourgauge metal or other material of equivalent strength that will withstand wear and tear and reasonably resist corrosion and acts of vandalism b receptacles should be constructed covered or used in such a manner as to prevent or preclude the blowing of litter from the receptacle c openings in covered litter receptacles shall be readily identifiable and readily accessible for the deposit of litter d construction and general configuration of litter receptacles shall be in conformance with all pertinent laws ordinances resolutions or regulations pertaining to fire safety public health or welfare e litter receptacles shall have a fifteenliquidgallon capacity 2 color and marking a the entire outer surface of each litter receptacle shall be white navy blue dark brown or tan if painted however if construction consists of aggregate concrete or wood its natural color is acceptable b each litter receptacle may bear the official louisiana antilitter logo as described in section 82034 c when the official state logo is used no commercial advertisement shall be placed on any litter receptacle within eight 8 inches of the official logo  and any such advertising may not exceed the logo in area the owner of the receptacle may place a single line on the receptacle identifying ownership and a single credit line designating any donor of the litter receptacle other than the owner that lettering may not exceed onehalf 12 inch in height and may not interfere with or distract from the prominence of the antilitter symbol 3 maintenance a compliance with these minimum standards shall include disposal of waste matter deposited proper upkeep maintenance and repair of litter receptacles sufficient to permit such receptacles to serve the functions for which they were designed and to prevent the appearance of such receptacles from becoming unsightly inadequately maintained or unsightly litter receptacles shall be a violation of these minimum standards b whenever litter receptacles are placed in any public place other than where required by these rules and regulations such receptacles shall conform to the provisions of this article  91190 antilitter symbol a all outdoor or public area litter receptacles so placed as to meet or exceed the provisions of this article may bear the official state antilitter the exclusive use of vehicles bearing a special license plate or displaying a parking card b owners lessees or their designees of privately owned parking areas may designate certain spaces within those parking areas which are to be reserved for the exclusive use of vehicles bearing a special license plate or displaying a parking card c it shall be unlawful for any person to park a vehicle other than one bearing a special license plate or displaying a parking card in an area either publicly owned or privately owned which has been designated as being reserved for the exclusive use of vehicles bearing a special license plate or displaying a parking card or for those who are mobility impaired d any person who parks in an area either publicly or privately owned which has been designated for the exclusive use of the mobility impaired person and who does not have a special license plate or parking card shall be fined not less than one hundred dollars $10000 and not more than five hundred dollars $50000 in addition to such fine the offender shall also be required to pay the towing fee and any storage costs which are incurred if the vehicle is towed e any person who year and the individual shall be fined not less than two hundred fifty dollars $25000 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 in addition to suspension of such privileges or shall be imprisoned not procedure for suspending or revoking permit the procedure for the suspension or revocation of permits shall be substantially as follows the city shall make periodic examinations of the business of all persons holding permits under this chapter if any violation of any provision of this chapter or of any rule or regulation of the city is observed the city may give the permittee a written warning however if the permittee has been previously warned or if the violation is of a sufficiently serious nature the city may prepare and file upon information and belief based upon the facts in hand a petition for suspension or revocation of the permit setting forth the facts and circumstances of the violation and shall thereupon summon the permittee to appear and show cause why the permit should not be suspended or revoked by the board of aldermen  state law reference procedure for suspending or revoking permit rs   cause necessary to withholding suspending or revoking of permit if a person vehicles and traffic state law reference municipal regulation of private ambulance services rs   emergency medical services rs  et seq uniform ambulance services a in general 1 name the provisions of this section shall be known as the uniform ambulance service  2 purpose and intent in order to insure that quality ambulance service is available to all residents of ouachita parish this section is intended to provide for the license of a sole licensed provider for ambulance service in ouachita parish louisiana and to provide for the uniform regulation of ambulance service throughout ouachita parish 3 findings and declaration in accordance with rs 1 the city of west monroe does hereby find and declare the following a the provision of consistent high quality emergency and nonemergency ambulance service and all aspects attendant to emergency and nonemergency operations provided by qualified personnel with advanced life support equipment is essential to health safety and welfare of the citizens and people within ouachita parish b exclusive access by an ambulance service for the provision of emergency medical services to the 911 or other emergency communication dispatcher in ouachita parish is essential to maintaining quick response time and consistency of care c it is in the best interest of the citizens of ouachita parish including those of the city of west monroe to license in accordance with the provisions of this section an exclusive provider of emergency and nonemergency ambulance service in ouachita parish such an exclusive license will best allow the city of west monroe the city of monroe and the ouachita parish police jury to demand accountability and performance from that provider with respect to response times and to guarantee the stability and accessibility of ambulance service in ouachita parish for a set term 4 territorial applicability upon adoption by the city of west monroe the provisions of this section shall become effective within the municipal limits of the city of west monroe 5 cooperation with other local governing authorities the city of west monroe authorizes its mayor to enter into such local services agreements andor cooperative endeavor agreements with the governing authoritys of any municipalitys and with the ouachita parish police jury as are necessary and proper to use the ouachita council of governments ocog and the ocog ambulance service advisory board to periodically select and license a sole provider of ambulance service in ouachita parish and to provide for the uniform regulation and oversight of such service throughout ouachita parish pursuant to the provisions of this section 6 definitions advanced life support als a advanced life support transport means transportation by ground ambulance vehicle permitted at the als level by the state and parish medically necessary supplies and services and either an als assessment by als personnel or the provision of at least one als intervention patients with emergency medical conditions as defined herein shall be provided with als transport b advanced life support assessment means an assessment performed by an als crew as part of an emergency response that was necessary because the patients reported condition at the time of dispatch suggested that als intervention was needed an als assessment does not necessarily result in a determination that the patient requires an als level of service c advanced life support intervention means a procedure that is in accordance with state and local laws beyond the scope of authority of an emergency medical technician these procedures include but are not limited to  intravenous therapy  manual defibrillationcardioversion  endotracheal intubation  central venous line insertion or monitoring  cardiac pacing  chest decompression  surgical airway  intraosseous lines  intravenous intramuscular or subcutaneous medication administration  inhalation sublingual or rectal medication administration  monitoring of pulse oximetry  monitoring of endtidal carbon dioxide d advanced life support personnel means an individual trained to the level of advanced emt or paramedic as defined by state laws and regulations who is qualified to perform enhanced advanced skills that include being able to administer a limited number of medications and perform other interventions e advanced life support ambulance service means the level of service attained when i the ambulance service provider is licensed as an advanced life support ambulance service by the louisiana bureau of ems and ii the ambulance service providers vehicles are permitted as advanced life support vehicles by the louisiana bureau of ems and each ambulance is occupied by at least one ambulance driver certified as an emt advanced emt or paramedic and at least one patient attendant minimally certified as a paramedic by the louisiana bureau of ems basic life support bls means transportation by ground ambulance vehicle and medically necessary supplies and services plus the provision of bls procedures as defined by the louisiana bureau of ems the ambulance must be staffed by a driver who is at a minimum qualified as an emt and a patient attendant who is at a minimum qualified as an emt ambulance committee the ocog ambulance committee shall administer the operations contract and serve as the regulatory entity for emergency medical condition means a medical condition manifesting itself by acute symptoms of sufficient severity including severe pain andor symptoms of substance abuse such that a prudent layperson who possess an average knowledge of health and medicine could reasonably expect the absence of immediate medical attention to result in placing the health of the individual or with respect to a pregnant woman the health of the woman or her unborn child in serious jeopardy serious impairment to bodily functions or serious dysfunction of any bodily organ or part except in major catastrophes and in disaster situations as declared by appropriate elected officials only ambulances that are permitted at the als level with als personnel may transport patients with emergency medical conditions emergency ambulance call means a situation that is classified at time of dispatch as a priority one or two under the emergency dispatch protocols established by the naemd national association of emergency medical dispatch or apco association of public safety communications officials or when the exact circumstances are unknown but the nature of the request is suggestive of a true emergency where a patient may be at risk als and bls ambulances or emrvs may respond to emergency ambulance calls but only als ambulances may transport patients with emergency medical conditions emergency ambulance call from a hospital means a call that at the time the call is made present circumstances in which there is an immediate need for a patient to be transported by ambulance from a hospital in ouachita parish the originating hospital to another hospital inside or outside ouachita parish so that the patient can receive a higher level of care or medical services that are not available at the originating hospital and the physician ordering the ambulance transport or otherwise referring the patient to another hospital certifies that a delay in the transport is likely to have an unfavorable impact on the patients outcome nonemergency ambulance call means a call for ambulance service that is not an emergency ambulance call nonemergency transportation by ambulance is appropriate if either the patient is bedconfined and it is documented that the patients condition is such that other methods of transportation are contraindicated  or if the patients medical condition regardless of bed confinement is such that transportation by ambulance is medically required emergency mode means an ambulance or emrv operating with emergency lights and warning siren may use air horn in addition to siren while engaged in an emergency ambulance call drivers of ambulances and emrvs shall operate in the emergency mode with warning lights and siren at all times while engaged in an emergency ambulance call if they are operating the emergency vehicle in a manner to take exemption to the traffic laws and rules of the road which may be allowed by state law so as to warn other drivers of nonemergency vehicles to yield the rightofway of the authorized emergency vehicle ambulances and emrvs may use emergency warning lights only if they are engaged in an emergency ambulance call and they are stopped or parked or if they are moving and operating the vehicle in a manner so as to abide by all traffic laws and regulations stipulated in state law no driver of any ambulance or emrv shall assume any special privilege from traffic laws and regulations except when such emergency vehicle is operated in the emergency mode with warning lights and siren while engaged in an emergency ambulance call emergency medical response vehicle emrv means a marked emergency vehicle with fully visual and audible warning signals operated by the parishlicensed ambulance service the primary purpose of which is to respond to the scene of a medical emergency to provide emergency medical stabilization or support or command control and communications but which is not an ambulance designed or car quick response vehicle special response vehicle triage trucks staff cars supervisor units and other similar designations personnel operating emrvs must be certified as either emt advanced emt or
